channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: France's Macron loses majority as defectors form new party
item.description: The French president's party loses seven MPs amid further signs of dissatisfaction in parliament.

item.title: Climate change: Scientists fear car surge will see CO2 rebound
item.description: An analysis shows a huge daily CO2 drop, but a return to car travel may see emissions rebound.

item.title: Hungary outlaws changing birth gender on documents
item.description: The government says the law will eliminate legal uncertainty, but trans people fear discrimination.

item.title: Coronavirus: Remote controlled mask invented to allow eating
item.description: Israeli investors have developed a coronavirus mask that has an automatic mouth hole.

item.title: China abductions: Parents find son snatched in hotel 32 years ago
item.description: Li Jingzhi quit her job to search China for her son, Mao Yin, who went missing in 1988.

item.title: Amphan: India and Bangladesh evacuate millions ahead of super cyclone
item.description: One of the biggest tropical storms in years is barrelling towards the coast of India and Bangladesh.

item.title: Coronavirus: World Health Organization members agree response probe
item.description: The vote follows criticism of the organisation and China, particularly from the United States.

item.title: University of Cambridge lectures to be online-only
item.description: There will be no face-to-face lectures in the next academic year due to coronavirus, the university says.

item.title: Coronavirus: Anger grows for stranded crew on forgotten cruises
item.description: Months into the pandemic, thousands of cruise crew remain stuck at sea, desperate to get home.

item.title: EasyJet admits data of nine million hacked
item.description: The attack was "sophisticated" the airline said, adding that some credit card details had been accessed.

item.title: Pakistan: Man who kissed murdered girls in video arrested
item.description: Police in Pakistan also detained two others believed to be involved in the teenagers' killings.

item.title: 'Tortured Zimbabwe abductees' may face prosecution
item.description: Opposition activists, including an MP, say they were beaten and forced to drink urine by state agents.

item.title: Megaraptor: Fossils of 10m-long dinosaur found in Argentina
item.description: Palaeontologists say the remains date back 70 million years, close to the end of the dinosaurs.

item.title: Coronavirus: Trump says he is taking unproven drug hydroxychloroquine
item.description: The president claims hydroxychloroquine is harmless but regulators warn it may cause heart problems.

item.title: Polish hit song on grieving 'censored', sparking protests
item.description: Public radio is accused of censoring an anti-government song that topped the charts.

item.title: Potato mountains and rotten cheese in Europe
item.description: Across Europe, much of the food and agriculture industry has been badly affected by the pandemic.

item.title: Killer Kicks: the secret in your trainers
item.description: The trainer industry now accounts for almost half of global footwear sales.

item.title: Australian man fined for rescuing whale from sea nets
item.description: After rescuers failed to arrive, the man launched his own rescue, driving his boat out to the whale.

item.title: Coronavirus: What's going wrong in Sweden's care homes?
item.description: Swedish healthcare is under scrutiny over the high rate of Covid-19 deaths in care homes.

item.title: Teranga, a Naples nightclub helping migrants overcome trauma
item.description: Teranga provides a safe space for migrants to dance and overcome their journey to Europe.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown: The harmonica player giving cheer to neighbours
item.description: Frederic Yonnet is an urban jazz harmonica player who believes music can bridge social distancing.

item.title: Mars: Mud flows on Red Planet behave like 'boiling toothpaste'
item.description: Scientists make a surprising discovery about the Red Planet by playing with mud in the laboratory.

item.title: Just Sam: American Idol crowns first ever 'at home' winner
item.description: The talent show's finalists performed remotely instead of in the usual studio.

item.title: Coronavirus: Fasting for Ramadan on the front line
item.description: What's it like to fast for Ramadan as a healthcare worker during the coronavirus pandemic?

item.title: Coronavirus: Tears inside Milan’s quarantine hotel
item.description: Italy may be reopening shops, restaurants and hairdressers, but people here are still living in limbo.

item.title: Lockdown in a virus-hit migrant camp
item.description: An Afghan journalist and refugee locked down in one of Europe’s migrant camps looks at the conditions in Malakasa camp.

item.title: Michael Jordan: NBA legend's trainers sell for record $560,000
item.description: Basketball legend Michael Jordan's autographed trainers from 1985 sell for a record $560,000 (£463,000) in an online auction.

item.title: Coronavirus: Barack Obama and LeBron James congratulate US graduates
item.description: Many schools have had to cancel ceremonies, so famous faces have sent the students messages.

item.title: Coronavirus: South Africans in massive queues for food parcels
item.description: Aerial footage shows thousands of people in snaking lines hoping to get supplies.

item.title: Burkina Faso unveils 'corrected' Thomas Sankara statue
item.description: A new monument to the African nationalist hero is unveiled after parts of the original "melted".

item.title: One every eight minutes: India's missing children
item.description: Many of those who vanish are trafficked and exploited, but there's little public outrage.

item.title: Meet the baby orangutans learning to climb trees
item.description: Baby orangutans are learning new skills from their human surrogate parents.

item.title: Coronavirus splits couple from baby born through surrogacy 8,000 miles away
item.description: Flavia and José have not yet been able to meet their baby, born through surrogacy seven weeks ago.

item.title: Scott Morrison: How Australia's PM rebuilt his reputation
item.description: Scott Morrison - yelled at by the public during the bushfires - is enjoying a political resurrection

item.title: Dark web scammers exploit Covid-19 fear and doubt
item.description: From miracle cures to co-ordinated hacking the dark web is a hive of coronavirus scamming.

item.title: Burundi election: Nkurunziza set to become 'supreme guide'
item.description: Burundi's president did everything to remain in power five years ago but is now stepping down - officially at least.

item.title: Fang Fang: The Wuhan writer whose virus diary angered China
item.description: A controversial diary written during the early days of the pandemic has been translated into English.

item.title: Coronavirus: They grabbed my breasts and said, 'You're not a woman'
item.description: Panama's lockdown allows men and women out on alternate days - but for trans people it's been tough.

item.title: Afghan maternity ward attack: The woman nursing the babies of murdered mothers
item.description: Firooza Omar volunteered to nurse newborns after a deadly attack on an Afghan maternity ward.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why Africans should take part in vaccine trials
item.description: Scientists in Africa explain that any trials would be properly regulated and so the scare stories should be ignored.

item.title: Coronavirus: Health workers face violent attacks in Mexico
item.description: While in many countries doctors and nurses are being praised for their work on the coronavirus front line, in Mexico dozens have been attacked.

item.title: Six positive coronavirus tests in Premier League
item.description: Three players and staff at Watford and Burnley's assistant manager Ian Woan are among six positive tests for coronavirus across three clubs.

item.title: Hudson-Odoi returns to Chelsea training after arrest
item.description: Chelsea winger Callum Hudson-Odoi returns to limited training on Tuesday following his arrest in the early hours of Sunday.

item.title: No British Grand Prix without quarantine exemptions
item.description: Formula 1 says it will be unable to hold a British Grand Prix if personnel are not given exemptions from plans to quarantine international travellers.

item.title: Man City's appeal against Uefa ban set for June
item.description: Manchester City's appeal against a two-year ban from European club competition will begin on 8 June at the Court of Arbitration for Sport (Cas).

item.title: Burnley assistant Woan tests positive for Covid-19
item.description: Burnley confirm their assistant manager Ian Woan was among six positive tests for coronavirus across three Premier League clubs.

item.title: Wednesday's gossip: Sane not interested in Liverpool move
item.description: Manchester City's Sane not interested in Liverpool move, Manchester United target Traore, Spurs' Vertonghen offered Betis deal, plus more.

item.title: Quiz: How well do you know the cricket world rankings?
item.description: Can you name the best Test, ODI and T20 teams in the world? And what about the leading players in each format?

item.title: Does chloroquine work against coronavirus?
item.description: President Trump says he takes the drug as a preventative measure. But what do we know about its effectiveness?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are President Trump's charges against the WHO?
item.description: The World Health Organization rejects US criticism it mishandled the early days of the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus: What's the risk on public transport?
item.description: Bus and train operators are reducing services and increasing cleaning.

item.title: Tracking the outbreak in maps and charts
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world and how it is being dealt with.

item.title: Coronavirus: How long does it take to recover?
item.description: Recovery from Covid-19 can be a lengthy process, depending on how seriously people get the virus.

item.title: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo takes coronavirus test live on TV
item.description: Andrew Cuomo says "there is nothing about the test that should intimidate people" into not taking it.

item.title: Coronavirus: South Africa's alcohol and cigarette lockdown
item.description: In South Africa, illegal sellers are defying the prohibition on buying alcohol and cigarettes.

item.title: Coronavirus: Can China test all of Wuhan in only 10 days?
item.description: Officials vowed to test all 11 million Wuhan residents in 10 days, but it appears they need longer.

item.title: Aarogya Setu: Why India's Covid-19 contact tracing app is controversial
item.description: Aarogya Setu, India's contact tracing app, has crossed 100 million downloads, but has raised concerns.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why 'shark attacks' won’t go down as Covid deaths
item.description: Infowars claims about testing, the viral body bag video in Brazil and other claims fact-checked.

item.title: Plinofficial: Russian rapper who loved dollars arrested by FBI
item.description: A cash-flaunting rapper from Siberia came to the US to become a global star. Where did it go wrong?

item.title: The Uber driver evicted from home and left to die of coronavirus
item.description: Rajesh Jayaseelan found himself homeless and sick in London with Covid-19. His widow tells his story.
